title: WHIRLING / LENA MAIN
description:
1. Learn Morell is missing.
2. Report on looking for Morell.
3. Cryptids white check.
4. Ask about Gary.
5. Finish Cryptozoologists case.

dialogueTree.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Hello, sweetie. How are you?" She..."
dialogueTree.text: "Hello, sweetie. How are you?" She sounds tired.

links.title: Perception (Sight): "Dark circles around her eyes. She's..."
links.text: Dark circles around her eyes. She's absolutely exhausted.

links.title: Empathy: "She asked about you because she's a..."
links.text: She asked about you because she's afraid to hear about the traps. But that's what she really wants news of.

links.title: You: ""I restocked the empty trap... Wher..."
links.text: "I restocked the empty trap... Where's Morell?"

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Thank you for doing that, dear." S..."
links.text: "Thank you for doing that, dear." She manages a smile for you.

links.title: Empathy: "Her smile is weary. Her earlier ebu..."
links.text: Her smile is weary. Her earlier ebullience has left her.

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Morell still isn't feeling well. I..."
links.text: "Morell still isn't feeling well. I convinced him to stay at Gary's to get some rest." She looks down at her hands. "I'm afraid the cold has really gotten to him."

links.title: You: ""Only the hard core players left, h..."
links.text: "Only the hard core players left, huh?"

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Yes." She smiles a cautious smile...."
links.text: "Yes." She smiles a cautious smile. "Field work is a young person's game, as they say..."

links.title: Drama: "Her voice is shaky. What is going o..."
links.text: Her voice is shaky. What is going on here?

links.title: You: ""So... who's going to check the tra..."
links.text: "So... who's going to check the traps?"

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Morell will eventually. Or we'll t..."
links.text: "Morell will eventually. Or we'll talk Gary into going back out, perhaps..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant stares at his shoe,..."
links.text: The lieutenant stares at his shoe, caked in mud. He doesn't say anything.

links.title: You: ""Something tells me it's up to me a..."
links.text: "Something tells me it's up to me again."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""No." She says -- insisting now. "Y..."
links.text: "No." She says -- insisting now. "You don't have to do that. Enough of this fool's errand, Morell will do it. Or Gary. You have work to do, I've wasted enough of everyone's time."

links.title: Logic: "Be real -- Gary is not going to hel..."
links.text: Be real -- Gary is not going to help with this.

links.title: You: ""I'll take care of it." (Take it on..."
links.text: "I'll take care of it." (Take it on.)

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""That *really* is too much, sweetie..."
links.text: "That *really* is too much, sweetie. Thank you for your dedication, but I can see you're coming down with a cough yourself."

links.title: Endurance: "Fuck that cough. It's not happening..."
links.text: Fuck that cough. It's not happening. The insides of your lungs are lined with *tobacco*, a powerful antibacterial agent. You are unstoppable.

links.title: Volition: "Very strange... why is she not lett..."
links.text: Very strange... why is she not letting you do this? It's like she's given up.

links.title: You: ""Once more onto the breach, then!"..."
links.text: "Once more onto the breach, then!" (Take it on with undue optimism.)

links.title: You: ""Good luck with that. My bug-chasin..."
links.text: "Good luck with that. My bug-chasing days are done."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""I absolutely understand, sweetie...."
links.text: "I absolutely understand, sweetie. It's for the best, believe me. And thank you for everything you've done for us, truly." She nods with a sad little smile.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Very strange... you get the sense s..."
links.text: Very strange... you get the sense she wouldn't have let you do this even if you did volunteer. Why?

links.title: Inland Empire: "You've come so far. You can't leave..."
links.text: You've come so far. You can't leave those locusts there, waiting on the ghost reed with no one to witness when it appears...

links.title: You: ""It's probably for the best. It's a..."
links.text: "It's probably for the best. It's awfully cold out there in those reeds."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""I'm sorry, dear -- you've had to d..."
links.text: "I'm sorry, dear -- you've had to drudge through them so many times. Such is field work -- a young person's game as they say."

links.title: You: ""He gives up and *I'm* running arou..."
links.text: "He gives up and *I'm* running around?"

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""I'm sorry, dear. It was me -- I ma..."
links.text: "I'm sorry, dear. It was me -- I made him go home. He gets *so* stubborn about these things -- luckily his cough kept him from arguing with me."

links.title: You: ""Lena, what's wrong? You seem diffe..."
links.text: "Lena, what's wrong? You seem different."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Different -- how?" The half-moons..."
links.text: "Different -- how?" The half-moons of her glasses reflect you as she looks up at you.

links.title: Rhetoric: "Answering a question with a questio..."
links.text: Answering a question with a question, for example -- defensive isn't her usual style.

links.title: You: ""You're... on the back foot.""
links.text: "You're... on the back foot."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""I'm... in doubt, sweetie. That's a..."
links.text: "I'm... in doubt, sweetie. That's all. Everyone is, now and then."

links.title: You: ""You're in doubt? About what?""
links.text: "You're in doubt? About what?"

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""It's... a strange feeling." She lo..."
links.text: "It's... a strange feeling." She looks down, biting her lower lip. "I haven't really told this to anyone, but... you *are* a police officer."

links.title: Authority: "And when a police officer asks -- y..."
links.text: And when a police officer asks -- you must answer.

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Do you ever wonder if some lovely..."
links.text: "Do you ever wonder if some lovely story from your childhood is just that... a story? Or a dream?"

links.title: Composure: "Hunching her shoulders now, she see..."
links.text: Hunching her shoulders now, she seems even smaller than she is. Like a sad young girl.

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Seeing the Insulindian phasmid was..."
links.text: "Seeing the Insulindian phasmid was just a story I used to tell people. I didn't really think about whether it was *real* or not."

links.title: You: ""But... Morell told me you'd seen i..."
links.text: "But... Morell told me you'd seen it. *You* also told me..."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Morell's so proud of it. He always..."
links.text: "Morell's so proud of it. He always tells everyone..."

links.title: Empathy: "A terrible sting in the heart. Regr..."
links.text: A terrible sting in the heart. Regret.

links.title: You: ""Are you saying you *made it up*?""
links.text: "Are you saying you *made it up*?"

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""No! At least... I don't think I di..."
links.text: "No! At least... I don't think I did. But Morell was so eager to believe my story was *evidence* of the phasmid's existence..."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""That I'm some Queen of the Cryptoz..."
links.text: "That I'm some Queen of the Cryptozoologists... That... And for years his belief made *me* believe too."

links.title: Suggestion: "That I'm a queen. An extraordinary..."
links.text: That I'm a queen. An extraordinary witness to grace.

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""But now we're both getting old, an..."
links.text: "But now we're both getting old, and he's still working himself sick out in those reeds, looking for it..." She shakes her head, still unable to meet your eyes. "But what if I was just *wrong*? I think I was..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant opens his notebook b..."
links.text: The lieutenant opens his notebook but doesn't write anything.

links.title: Volition: "He's hiding. These things are tough..."
links.text: He's hiding. These things are tough on him. Matters of love, not violence or deceit.

links.title: You: "First, tell her that her marriage h..."
links.text: First, tell her that her marriage hasn't been a lie.

links.title: Suggestion: "An acorn is not the same as the tre..."
links.text: An acorn is not the same as the tree. That requires time, diligence, and care...

links.title: You: "And? I need something *good* here."
links.text: And? I need something *good* here.

links.title: Suggestion: "All qualities these two seem to sha..."
links.text: All qualities these two seem to share in abundance.

links.title: You: ""Wrong or not, your relationship wi..."
links.text: "Wrong or not, your relationship with Morell isn't just about the phasmid."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""But it *is*. We've spent years sea..."
links.text: "But it *is*. We've spent years searching for the phasmid, hunting it together. Without it, what are we? Just another pathetic old couple..."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""If I hadn't led him down this path..."
links.text: "If I hadn't led him down this path he could have a steady job lecturing at a university."

links.title: Encyclopedia: "You know, this reminds you of the P..."
links.text: You know, this reminds you of the Perikarnassian Theory of Love. In essence, love is a relay -- out of death. Generation by generation, our love remains in our progeny. Lay some of *that* on her!

links.title: You: ""You know, the Perikarnassians theo..."
links.text: "You know, the Perikarnassians theorized that *love* was the key to immortality..."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Oh, sweetie. I don't think the Per..."
links.text: "Oh, sweetie. I don't think the Perikarnassians were thinking of people in *my* situation." She looks down at her legs...

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""I was a paraplegic before we met...."
links.text: "I was a paraplegic before we met. He didn't know before I arrived... on our first date. If I weren't the Queen of the Cryptozoologists... If I didn't tell him that story..."

links.title: Composure: "She has to swallow to relax her thr..."
links.text: She has to swallow to relax her throat. It's keeping her from talking.

links.title: You: ""Morell hated lecturing. You convin..."
links.text: "Morell hated lecturing. You convinced him to do something real in this world."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""But if the dream comes to naught,..."
links.text: "But if the dream comes to naught, what good is it? No, the thing is..." She looks down at her legs...

links.title: You: ""Normally when I think about stuff..."
links.text: "Normally when I think about stuff like *women* and *marriage*, I feel *bad*. When I think about you and Morell I feel okay. That counts for something, no?"

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Oh, of course it counts for someth..."
links.text: "Oh, of course it counts for something. But we've had our hard times too..." She looks down at her legs...

links.title: Suggestion: "But it *has*, hasn't it? A seed can..."
links.text: But it *has*, hasn't it? A seed can only bear what's inside it. The seed of love is black and oily.

links.title: Suggestion: "It has a taste *you're* quite famil..."
links.text: It has a taste *you're* quite familiar with.

links.title: You: ""Lying has gotten you this far, why..."
links.text: "Lying has gotten you this far, why stop now?"

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""You might be right, detective..."..."
links.text: "You might be right, detective..." She looks down at her legs...

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""I was a paraplegic before we met...."
links.text: "I was a paraplegic before we met. He didn't know before I came in, on our first date. If I weren't the Queen of the Cryptozoologists... If I didn't tell him that story..."

links.title: Composure: "She has to swallow to relax her thr..."
links.text: She has to swallow to relax her throat. It's keeping her from talking.

links.title: You: ""He'd still be into you. That's not..."
links.text: "He'd still be into you. That's not how these things work."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Maybe. But then why do I not dare..."
links.text: "Maybe. But then why do I not dare tell him?" She sighs. "I've wasted enough of your time with this drama. I really must stop talking about it, lest I start crying and waste *more* of your time."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""What you have to know is, the Insu..."
links.text: "What you have to know is, the Insulindian phasmid probably does not exist. Let us fools chase our ghosts. There are a million better things to do with your life."

links.title: Conceptualization: "*Are* there? Some of the other thin..."
links.text: *Are* there? Some of the other things are pretty bad.

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""My point is, the Insulindian phasm..."
links.text: "My point is, the Insulindian phasmid *probably* does not exist. And you were right to put your bug-chasing days behind you."

links.title: You: ""*Now* I understand why you haven't..."
links.text: "*Now* I understand why you haven't told him about your doubts."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: "She sighs. "I've wasted enough of y..."
links.text: She sighs. "I've wasted enough of your time with this drama. I really must stop talking about it, lest I start crying and waste *more* of your time."

links.title: You: ""Wow, love is *hard*.""
links.text: "Wow, love is *hard*."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""It's not easy..." She sighs. "I've..."
links.text: "It's not easy..." She sighs. "I've wasted enough of your time with this drama. I really must stop talking about it, lest I start crying and waste *more* of your time."

links.title: You: "Say nothing."
links.text: Say nothing.

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: "She sighs. "I've wasted enough of y..."
links.text: She sighs. "I've wasted enough of your time with this drama. I really must go before I start crying and waste *more* of it."

links.title: You: ""To hell with this. *I* still belie..."
links.text: "To hell with this. *I* still believe you saw the phasmid."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""A true believer," she looks out th..."
links.text: "A true believer," she looks out the window. "Sometimes I still see it, too. The real memory of it. How it was there... Not the memory *of* the memory. But it's so hard to tell the two apart..."

links.title: Inland Empire: "Rising, unfolding from the reeds on..."
links.text: Rising, unfolding from the reeds on a hot summer's day... like a benevolent god.

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Either way, I should go. Poor More..."
links.text: "Either way, I should go. Poor Morell is running a fever and I need to get him home to Jamrock. Before we overstay our welcome with Gary."

links.title: You: ""Thing is, you're not sure you made..."
links.text: "Thing is, you're not sure you made it up either."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""I'm not sure of anything." She loo..."
links.text: "I'm not sure of anything." She looks out the window. "Sometimes I still see it, you know. The real memory. Not the memory of the memory, but it's so hard to tell the two apart..."

links.title: You: ""Okay, it's a false memory. Doesn't..."
links.text: "Okay, it's a false memory. Doesn't mean all cryptids aren't real. Chase another one."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Of course not -- I didn't mean to..."
links.text: "Of course not -- I didn't mean to say my situation discredits the field. There have been *some* confirmed discoveries. And a lot of hoaxes too, but still..." She looks to the door.

links.title: You: ""You're right about all of it. And..."
links.text: "You're right about all of it. And I need to get back to my work."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Yes, I should go now. Poor Morell..."
links.text: "Yes, I should go now. Poor Morell is running a fever. I need to get him home to Jamrock, before we overstay our welcome with Gary."

links.title: You: ""Are you sure you don't need help g..."
links.text: "Are you sure you don't need help getting to Gary's?"

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Oh no. Thank you, but I can get th..."
links.text: "Oh no. Thank you, but I can get there on my own, this old thing is gas-powered." She taps her chair. "And then a taxi home. It's not so bad."

links.title: You: ""You do that. I'll check the traps..."
links.text: "You do that. I'll check the traps one more time."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Really?""
links.text: "Really?"

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Oh sweetie..." She looks at you, w..."
links.text: "Oh sweetie..." She looks at you, worried. "Please don't get stuck on a dream. Take it from me and Morell."

links.title: Volition: "No one can STOP you from finding th..."
links.text: No one can STOP you from finding the phasmid.

links.title: You: ""Can I have your address? Just in c..."
links.text: "Can I have your address? Just in case there's news."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Okay, it's 1113 Tabernacle Road. J..."
links.text: "Okay, it's 1113 Tabernacle Road. Jamrock, but..."

links.title: Empathy: "A sigh. She doesn't think you'll ne..."
links.text: A sigh. She doesn't think you'll need it.

links.title: You: ""Be careful out there, Lena." (Conc..."
links.text: "Be careful out there, Lena." (Conclude.)

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""You too, sweetie." She flicks a sw..."
links.text: "You too, sweetie." She flicks a switch and the engine on her chair turns on with a whir. "Thank you for everything. Truly.  Even though it turned out to be a..." The sentence remains unfinished.

links.title: Rhetoric: "A waste of time?"
links.text: A waste of time?

links.title: Inland Empire: "A dream?"
links.text: A dream?

links.title: Drama: "A lie?"
links.text: A lie?

links.title: Perception (Hearing): "A *fool's hope* -- say her lips mov..."
links.text: A *fool's hope* -- say her lips moving in silence.

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: "Like that, she drives off. The gas..."
links.text: Like that, she drives off. The gas engine putters quietly, as she gets to the doors -- then pushes them open. Outside the cold coastal wind blows.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We should go too.""
links.text: "We should go too."

links.title: Shivers: "Somewhere out there -- a kilometre..."
links.text: Somewhere out there -- a kilometre to the southeast -- a gust of wind shakes the Feld building, rattling dusty windows, beckoning with strange coldness. To ask the wind once more.

links.title: You: ""It's been a pleasure, ma'am." (Con..."
links.text: "It's been a pleasure, ma'am." (Conclude.)

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Likewise, sweetie." She flicks a s..."
links.text: "Likewise, sweetie." She flicks a switch on her chair and the engine turns on with a whir. "Thank you for everything. Truly. Even though it turned out to be a..." The sentence remains unfinished.

links.title: You: ""The rest of it is pretty grim. Tha..."
links.text: "The rest of it is pretty grim. Thanks for bringing some light." (Conclude.)

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""You're welcome, sweetie." She flic..."
links.text: "You're welcome, sweetie." She flicks a switch on her chair and the engine turns on with a whir. "I'm glad it helped you, even though it turned out to be a..." The sentence remains unfinished.

links.title: You: ""The story is real to you and him...."
links.text: "The story is real to you and him. That's what matters."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""No, sweetie," she shakes her head,..."
links.text: "No, sweetie," she shakes her head, "there's more to it than that. Morell was so eager to believe my story was *evidence* of the phasmid's existence..."

links.title: You: ""So you haven't seen it? I should a..."
links.text: "So you haven't seen it? I should arrest you for lying."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Oh, sweetie, I wish it were that s..."
links.text: "Oh, sweetie, I wish it were that simple. But it's not. Morell was so eager to believe my story was *evidence* of the phasmid's existence..."

links.title: You: ""But... Morell told me you'd seen i..."
links.text: "But... Morell told me you'd seen it."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""He's so proud of it. He always tel..."
links.text: "He's so proud of it. He always tells everyone..."

links.title: You: ""You've given up on the phasmid.""
links.text: "You've given up on the phasmid."

links.title: You: ""You're not telling me the whole st..."
links.text: "You're not telling me the whole story."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""I'm... not. It's not that..." She..."
links.text: "I'm... not. It's not that..." She doesn't know how to end the sentence.

links.title: You: ""What is it?""
links.text: "What is it?"

links.title: You: ""Never mind.""
links.text: "Never mind."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Right..." She looks around. "It's..."
links.text: "Right..." She looks around. "It's almost time for me to go too. I can't see what use I can be here..."

links.title: You: ""I ran into your husband on the coa..."
links.text: "I ran into your husband on the coast."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Goodness! How is he? Did he say wh..."
links.text: "Goodness! How is he? Did he say why he hasn't returned yet?" The old woman clasps her hands together over her blanket.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""He's fine, ma'am. He couldn't get..."
links.text: "He's fine, ma'am. He couldn't get back earlier because the water lock on the canal was broken. Now he's just finishing up some work."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Oh, yes, that's my Morell -- he's..."
links.text: "Oh, yes, that's my Morell -- he's bound to catch a cold, staying out there for so long... "

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""But I am so relieved to hear that..."
links.text: "But I am so relieved to hear that he's okay. Thank you for putting an old woman's heart at ease, if even a little."

links.title: Conceptualization: "Now maybe she'll open up about thos..."
links.text: Now maybe she'll open up about those *fascinating cryptids*. Take her mind off all this...

links.title: Empathy: "You haven't, however. There are dan..."
links.text: You haven't, however. There are dangers out there, our ageing bodies fail... her heart won't rest until Morell is safely back with her.

links.title: You: ""He's fine, ma'am. He couldn't get..."
links.text: "He's fine, ma'am. He couldn't get back earlier because the water lock on the canal was broken. Now he's just finishing up some work..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""He's fine, ma'am. He couldn't get..."
links.text: "He's fine, ma'am. He couldn't get back earlier because the water lock on the canal was broken. He should be back soon."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""I hope so! He's going to catch a c..."
links.text: "I hope so! He's going to catch a cold, staying out there for so long..."

links.title: You: ""He's fine. He couldn't get back be..."
links.text: "He's fine. He couldn't get back before because the water lock on the canal was broken. I'm sure he'll be back soon."

links.title: You: ""You never told me you've *seen* th..."
links.text: "You never told me you've *seen* the phasmid!"

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Oh... you don't want to hear about..."
links.text: "Oh... you don't want to hear about some old woman's ramblings..."

links.title: You: ""You were on a date?""
links.text: "You were on a date?"

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Our first, yes." The old woman loo..."
links.text: "Our first, yes." The old woman looks at her husband tenderly...

links.title: Drama: "The glance is tender, yes, but temp..."
links.text: The glance is tender, yes, but tempered by something else, a thought she can't express even to him... Interesting.

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Our first, yes." The old woman sig..."
links.text: "Our first, yes." The old woman sighs tenderly...

links.title: Drama: "The sigh is tender, yes, but temper..."
links.text: The sigh is tender, yes, but tempered by something else, a thought she can't express... Interesting.

links.title: You: ""Its limbs are white?""
links.text: "Its limbs are white?"

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""Not all of them." He answers for h..."
links.text: "Not all of them." He answers for her. "There is some white colouration reported, along with beige, where the camouflage ends."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Not all of them, as far as I remem..."
links.text: "Not all of them, as far as I remember. But some of them -- on the inside. Like stalks of marble if that makes sense..."

links.title: You: ""How big was it?""
links.text: "How big was it?"

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""It's hard to say how big things ar..."
links.text: "It's hard to say how big things are when you're quite *small* yourself. To me, it seemed to be taller than I was then... but that's probably not the case."

links.title: Visual Calculus: "What if it *is* the case?"
links.text: What if it *is* the case?

links.title: You: ""Maybe you imagined it, Lena?""
links.text: "Maybe you imagined it, Lena?"

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""How could she? Who imagines this?..."
links.text: "How could she? Who imagines this? She didn't *know* about the phasmid. This is the main thing here, what makes it a confirmed sighting -- she had no previous knowledge of the insect."

links.title: Logic: "So she couldn't have made it up. Or..."
links.text: So she couldn't have made it up. Or imagined it.

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""That's true, yes. I'm almost certa..."
links.text: "That's true, yes. I'm almost certain neither my mother nor my grandmother knew of it. It was only when I started telling my story as a teenager that boys would tell me: Lena..." She lowers her voice, imitating a boy.

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Of course -- I've thought about it..."
links.text: "Of course -- I've thought about it. But Morell says my report matches with the others. And I'm sure I hadn't heard of the phasmid as a child. Nor had my mother -- or my grandmother."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""So how did I know what to imagine?..."
links.text: "So how did I know what to imagine? It was only when I started telling my story as a teenager that boys would tell me: Lena..." She lowers her voice, imitating a boy.

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""'You tryna' tell us you saw the In..."
links.text: "'You tryna' tell us you saw the Insulindian phasmid out there in those reeds? Get outta here!'" She smiles. "They'd just give me a cider and ruffle my hair and tell me to stop dreaming -- but I saw it."

links.title: You: ""Kim, what do you think of this?""
links.text: "Kim, what do you think of this?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I thought it was a wonderful story..."
links.text: "I thought it was a wonderful story, ma'am." He closes his notes and gives her a simple smile.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "But I don't believe it. A child, le..."
links.text: But I don't believe it. A child, left unattended, on a warm day. Children make up stories and then end up believing them.

links.title: You: ""Thank you for sharing this with me..."
links.text: "Thank you for sharing this with me." (Conclude.)

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""You're welcome, sweetie. I do appr..."
links.text: "You're welcome, sweetie. I do appreciate the chance to relive it, whenever I get one. It was just..." she sighs. "Such an impossibly sunshiny day. So warm."

links.title: Empathy: "And she could get up and walk -- ri..."
links.text: And she could get up and walk -- right into the reeds on her own. Into the mud. Anywhere.

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""'Ramblings'? Nonsense! Your descri..."
links.text: "'Ramblings'? Nonsense! Your description of the phasmid is the most precise I've ever heard!"

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""But darling, I didn't even get the..."
links.text: "But darling, I didn't even get the *size* of it right."

links.title: Visual Calculus: "Measuring things is important. How..."
links.text: Measuring things is important. How did she get the size?

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""You were a *child*, my dear. Reall..."
links.text: "You were a *child*, my dear. Really, it's extraordinary what you were able to describe. Now go on, tell our friend about it. He's proven his interest in the field."

links.title: Suggestion: "That is a way, *way* bigger complim..."
links.text: That is a way, *way* bigger compliment than it sounds like.

links.title: You: ""No -- I really want to know.""
links.text: "No -- I really want to know."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "Reflexively, the lieutenant readies..."
links.text: Reflexively, the lieutenant readies his familiar notebook.

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Well, it was summer," she starts...."
links.text: "Well, it was summer," she starts. "I was building a racing track out of sand on the beach near a tall stand of reeds. Quite a tall one, many times my height, I remember. When all of a sudden..."

links.title: You: ""Wait. Where was this and how old w..."
links.text: "Wait. Where was this and how old were you?"

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Ah, I'm getting ahead of myself. I..."
links.text: "Ah, I'm getting ahead of myself. I was five and a half. In Betancourt, in the suburbs. My grandmother had a summer home there."

links.title: Empathy: "She'd just started forming memories..."
links.text: She'd just started forming memories. Real memories, not the billowy haze of infanthood.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Betancourt got bombed in the war. I..."
links.text: Betancourt got bombed in the war. It used to be quite near. Circa 20 kilometres from here.

links.title: You: ""What happened?""
links.text: "What happened?"

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""The strangest moment of my life: I..."
links.text: "The strangest moment of my life: I looked up and one of the reeds *moved*. Not like a plant, but like a living thing -- it stood up and looked at me. Its body unfolded like some antique toy... I've never seen anything like it."

links.title: Half Light: "She had no fear. Just surprise."
links.text: She had no fear. Just surprise.

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""I didn't know this can happen, so..."
links.text: "I didn't know this can happen, so I reached my arm and touched the thing. It felt just like a stalk of reed, but it moved. Swaying, towering above me..." She looks at you. "After a while -- 20 seconds? a minute, maybe? -- it left. Went into the reeds."

links.title: You: ""Did you follow it?""
links.text: "Did you follow it?"

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""I tried, but I was only a child. T..."
links.text: "I tried, but I was only a child. There was mud and high water, I couldn't see it anymore. I was just standing there, knee deep in mud, looking around me..."

links.title: Inland Empire: "Where did you go? Don't go..."
links.text: Where did you go? Don't go...

links.title: You: ""Then what?""
links.text: "Then what?"

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""I ran back home to my grandmother..."
links.text: "I ran back home to my grandmother and asked her if *reeds* could *walk* and told her they were looking at me." She chuckles. "Of course, she just laughed at me, but I knew what I'd seen..."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""For years it was a story I told at..."
links.text: "For years it was a story I told at parties, when I wanted to impress *boys*, that sort of thing." She brushes her hair back. "Of course, most people just took it as a strange, amusing anecdote. So did I, honestly. But then I met Morell..."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""We were on a date, can you imagine..."
links.text: "We were on a date, can you imagine? She tells me a story and it's the most detailed report of the Insulindian phasmid I've ever heard. The sounds -- she told me it hissed..."

links.title: Suggestion: "So that's how they met. This is *be..."
links.text: So that's how they met. This is *beyond* significant for them.

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""It did, yes -- like reeds in a gus..."
links.text: "It did, yes -- like reeds in a gust of wind."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""...the way it moved, the colour, h..."
links.text: "...the way it moved, the colour, how some of its limbs were white like marble..." He breathes excitedly. "It matched *perfectly* with what I know from other accounts! It was amazing."

links.title: Morell, the Cryptozoologist: ""If it weren't for Lena, I might've..."
links.text: "If it weren't for Lena, I might've given up hope years ago. It's no exaggeration to say that she restored my faith in my profession." He looks at her with admiration, forgetting a wide smile on his face.

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""We were on our first date when I t..."
links.text: "We were on our first date when I told him my story. You should have seen his face..." She smiles. "He said my descriptions match the phasmid down to a tee: its white marble limbs, the way it moved..."

links.title: Suggestion: "So that's how they met. This is *be..."
links.text: So that's how they met. This is *beyond* significant for them.

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""I looked up and one of the reeds m..."
links.text: "I looked up and one of the reeds moved. Not like a plant, but like a living thing. It stood up and looked at me. Its body unfolded, like some antique toy..." She shakes her head. "I'd never seen anything like it. The reeds turned into a creature."

links.title: You: ""You must be mistaken. I'm a connoi..."
links.text: "You must be mistaken. I'm a connoisseur of delusional ramblings."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""That's kind of you, but I've got t..."
links.text: "That's kind of you, but I've got to demur. It's hard to tell a story you don't really believe in anymore..."

links.title: You: ""Let's change the subject for now.""
links.text: "Let's change the subject for now."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Yes, sweetie?""
links.text: "Yes, sweetie?"

links.title: You: ""The water lock on the canal is bro..."
links.text: "The water lock on the canal is broken, so your husband is probably just stuck on the other side of the coast."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Oh, my! What happened to the water..."
links.text: "Oh, my! What happened to the water lock?"

links.title: You: ""I broke it. Drove my motor carriag..."
links.text: "I broke it. Drove my motor carriage into a billboard above the lock, blocking the gates."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Oh, sweetie... Well, I'm glad you..."
links.text: "Oh, sweetie... Well, I'm glad you survived that. And I'm grateful for the information -- it will spare me another sleepless night."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You're welcome, ma'am.""
links.text: "You're welcome, ma'am."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Listen, sweetie. I hate to ask, bu..."
links.text: "Listen, sweetie. I hate to ask, but if your investigation happens to take you to the other side of the coast, please do keep an eye out for my husband..."

links.title: Authority: "Of course. You're a cop, you were *..."
links.text: Of course. You're a cop, you were *born* to do this stuff.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "The quest for knowledge is never ov..."
links.text: The quest for knowledge is never over!

links.title: Inland Empire: "This will *surely* lead to a crypto..."
links.text: This will *surely* lead to a cryptozoological mystery with that *extremely rare insect*...

links.title: Conceptualization: "Yes! Some left-field scientific res..."
links.text: Yes! Some left-field scientific research is exactly what you need right now. Funk up that *vanilla* murder investigation.

links.title: You: ""You may not believe it, but it loo..."
links.text: "You may not believe it, but it looks like some maniac crashed his motor carriage into it."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Oh, sweetie, if it weren't for you..."
links.text: "Oh, sweetie, if it weren't for you I'd be looking forward to another sleepless night. Thank you, from the bottom of my heart!"

links.title: You: ""Wouldn't you know, it's blocked by..."
links.text: "Wouldn't you know, it's blocked by a big butter billboard -- it fell right into the water!"

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Oh, sweetie, if it weren't for you..."
links.text: "Oh, sweetie, if it weren't for you I'd be looking forward to another sleepless night. Thank you, from the bottom of my heart!"

links.title: You: ""Probably just some technical probl..."
links.text: "Probably just some technical problem."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Well, whatever the cause, I'm than..."
links.text: "Well, whatever the cause, I'm thankful. You've spared me another sleepless night."

links.title: You: ""Word around the canal is some weir..."
links.text: "Word around the canal is some weird new cryptid destroyed it."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Oh, now you're just having fun at..."
links.text: "Oh, now you're just having fun at an old woman's expense! In any case, thank you for looking into this. It takes a weight off my shoulders."

links.title: You: ""I really don't know.""
links.text: "I really don't know."

links.title: You: ""Turns out the water lock was broke..."
links.text: "Turns out the water lock was broken, so your husband is probably just stuck further down the coast. He should return now that it's fixed."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: "Her eyes light up. "What wonderful..."
links.text: Her eyes light up. "What wonderful news!"

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Thank you, dear. You've already do..."
links.text: "Thank you, dear. You've already done so much, but if your investigation happens to take you to the other side of the coast, please do keep an eye out for my husband..."

links.title: Inland Empire: "Of course. Do it. Who knows what my..."
links.text: Of course. Do it. Who knows what mysteries await?

links.title: Encyclopedia: "The quest for knowledge is never ov..."
links.text: The quest for knowledge is never over!

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""And if you see him, let him know L..."
links.text: "And if you see him, let him know Lena is waiting for him here at the Whirling. He gets so tangled up in his work that he may not know the water lock's been repaired. And it's *cold* out there..."

links.title: You: ""If I see him, I'll let him know yo..."
links.text: "If I see him, I'll let him know you're here -- when or *if* I get there." (Accept task.)

links.title: You: ""I've really spent too much time on..."
links.text: "I've really spent too much time on this side-case as it is." (Reject task.)

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Oh, of course, sweetie. I understa..."
links.text: "Oh, of course, sweetie. I understand." She smiles brightly to mask her disappointment.

links.title: You: ""I've changed my mind. I'll tell Mo..."
links.text: "I've changed my mind. I'll tell Morell you're worried."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Oh, you're such a dear! Thank you,..."
links.text: "Oh, you're such a dear! Thank you, sweetie."

links.title: You: ""What is this *expedition* your hus..."
links.text: "What is this *expedition* your husband was on?"

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Just some field work, sweetie. Mor..."
links.text: "Just some field work, sweetie. Morell is a highly trained scientist. He and his assistant, Gary, are studying an *extremely rare* species of insect..."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""But they should have returned by n..."
links.text: "But they should have returned by now. They were just going down the coast, across the water lock, to set a few traps. He said they'd be back on Monday..." She sighs. "What could be keeping them?"

links.title: Logic: "The water lock! That was broken. Co..."
links.text: The water lock! That was broken. Could this be it?

links.title: You: ""Wait, who's this 'Gary' person? Do..."
links.text: "Wait, who's this 'Gary' person? Do you trust him?"

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Oh, sweetie. It's nothing like tha..."
links.text: "Oh, sweetie. It's nothing like that..." She smiles.

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Gary's as loyal as they come. I'd..."
links.text: "Gary's as loyal as they come. I'd trust him with my husband's life any day."

links.title: You: ""Are they in a *rough neighbourhood..."
links.text: "Are they in a *rough neighbourhood*?"

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""There's a nameless old fishing vil..."
links.text: "There's a nameless old fishing village nearby, but we've never had any trouble there before..." She stops, then continues, worried. "There is a lot of crime around here, isn't there?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I can't say it's the best part of..."
links.text: "I can't say it's the best part of town, but I wouldn't worry *too much* about a pair of grown men travelling together."

links.title: Suggestion: "The lieutenant doesn't want to agit..."
links.text: The lieutenant doesn't want to agitate the woman.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Do it. Find her husband. This will..."
links.text: Do it. Find her husband. This will *surely* lead to a cryptozoological mystery with that *extremely rare insect*...

links.title: Conceptualization: "Some fringe-science is *exactly* wh..."
links.text: Some fringe-science is *exactly* what's needed right now. Spice up that *vanilla* murder investigation.

links.title: You: ""You mentioned traps. Could there b..."
links.text: "You mentioned traps. Could there be some problem with them?"

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""I doubt it, sweetie. The traps are..."
links.text: "I doubt it, sweetie. The traps aren't big enough for humans to get caught in them. They're for the insect. Anyway..." She looks around.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Do it. Find him. This will *surely*..."
links.text: Do it. Find him. This will *surely* lead to a mystery with that *extremely rare insect*...

links.title: Conceptualization: "Yes, please. Some science fiction i..."
links.text: Yes, please. Some science fiction is *exactly* what's needed right now. Spice up that *vanilla* murder investigation.

links.title: You: ""This sounds like police business...."
links.text: "This sounds like police business. I'll help you find your husband." (Accept task.)

links.title: You: ""That's too bad. I hope your husban..."
links.text: "That's too bad. I hope your husband comes back soon." (Decline task.)

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Yes, well, thank you for your time..."
links.text: "Yes, well, thank you for your time, officer. I'm probably just worrying for no reason. I'm sure they'll return before long..."

links.title: Empathy: "There's a note of disappointment in..."
links.text: There's a note of disappointment in her voice that she can't quite suppress.

links.title: You: ""Don't worry. You've asked me to lo..."
links.text: "Don't worry. You've asked me to look into it and I will."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Thank you, sweetie. I'm awfully so..."
links.text: "Thank you, sweetie. I'm awfully sorry to impose on you like this -- maybe there's something *I* can help *you* with in the meanwhile?"

links.title: You: ""Maybe your husband went off on an..."
links.text: "Maybe your husband went off on an adventure?"

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Goodness, no! Well, we did get sep..."
links.text: "Goodness, no! Well, we did get separated once before, during that *monsoon* in South Safre. But we were younger then, and Morell always takes the appropriate precautions..."

links.title: You: ""The water lock to the other side o..."
links.text: "The water lock to the other side of the coast is broken. They're probably just stuck over there." (Proceed.)

links.title: You: ""I've changed my mind. I'll help yo..."
links.text: "I've changed my mind. I'll help you find your husband after all."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Are you sure we have time to go ch..."
links.text: "Are you sure we have time to go chasing after bug-hunters just now?" The lieutenant taps his foot impatiently.

links.title: You: ""It's just a little side-thing, we'..."
links.text: "It's just a little side-thing, we'll do it down the line."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "He sighs. "If you say so.""
links.text: He sighs. "If you say so."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Oh, thank you officers, truly. I'l..."
links.text: "Oh, thank you officers, truly. I'll be right here if you come across any sign of Morell."

links.title: You: ""I've already given my word. I'm ho..."
links.text: "I've already given my word. I'm honour-bound to uphold it."

links.title: You: ""I've got a *premonition* that this..."
links.text: "I've got a *premonition* that this missing scientist is connected to our main case."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "He sighs. "I sincerely doubt it. St..."
links.text: He sighs. "I sincerely doubt it. Still, I suppose it won't hurt to keep an eye out."

links.title: You: ""I think it would be good to take a..."
links.text: "I think it would be good to take a break from the hanged-man for a little while."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "A sigh. He takes off his glasses an..."
links.text: A sigh. He takes off his glasses and wipes the lenses on his jacket before replacing them.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Well, the man's already been dead..."
links.text: "Well, the man's already been dead more than a week..." He concludes. "I suppose a *small* diversion won't hurt too much."

links.title: You: ""It's just police-work.""
links.text: "It's just police-work."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes, but a junior officer could......"
links.text: "Yes, but a junior officer could..." He takes off his glasses and thinks. Then puts them back on without wiping.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Fine, our victim's already been de..."
links.text: "Fine, our victim's already been dead more than a week. One more diversion won't change anything."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Oh, thank you sweetie, truly. I'll..."
links.text: "Oh, thank you sweetie, truly. I'll be right here if you come across any sign of Morell."

links.title: You: ""So your husband is some kind of sc..."
links.text: "So your husband is some kind of scientist?"

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Oh yes," she says with a pinch of..."
links.text: "Oh yes," she says with a pinch of pride. "A zoologist -- a *crypto*zoologist to be more precise."

links.title: You: ""What is cryptozoology?""
links.text: "What is cryptozoology?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It's a pseudo-science that attempt..."
links.text: "It's a pseudo-science that attempts to legitimize *research* into mythological beasts and urban legends." The lieutenant sounds unimpressed.

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""That's one opinion, yes. And peopl..."
links.text: "That's one opinion, yes. And people are entitled to their opinions..."

links.title: Composure: "She's used to playing off such insu..."
links.text: She's used to playing off such insults casually, but they still affect her.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""My apologies, ma'am. I did not mea..."
links.text: "My apologies, ma'am. I did not mean to undermine your hobby."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""It's not a hobby, dear. It's a *su..."
links.text: "It's not a hobby, dear. It's a *sub-field* of zoology, one specializing in animal species that are so exceedingly rare that many assume them to be *extinct* or even *fictitious*..."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""It's really just a *sub-field* of..."
links.text: "It's really just a *sub-field* of zoology, one specializing in animal species that are so exceedingly rare that many assume them to be *extinct* or even *fictitious*..."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Searching for such species -- call..."
links.text: "Searching for such species -- called *cryptids* -- is difficult and often thankless, and frankly, many scientists are too lazy to do it. Universities these days are rarely interested in supporting *real* research."

links.title: Encyclopedia: "The quality of research at Revachol..."
links.text: The quality of research at Revacholian universities *has* been on the decline, but you doubt there was ever a time when *cryptozoology* was embraced by the academic elite.

links.title: Empathy: "She's completely internalized her h..."
links.text: She's completely internalized her husband's struggles. They are her own.

links.title: You: ""Tell me more about Morell. Looks,..."
links.text: "Tell me more about Morell. Looks, character, your relationship..."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Oh dear... I'm not sure where to b..."
links.text: "Oh dear... I'm not sure where to begin..."

links.title: You: ""What does your husband look like?""
links.text: "What does your husband look like?"

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Hmmm. Well, his expression is slig..."
links.text: "Hmmm. Well, his expression is slightly grumpy, but his eyes are always bright and curious, like a small boy's. And his palms are quite coarse from all the field work, but he's quite gentle..."

links.title: Logic: "You can't go around Revachol feelin..."
links.text: You can't go around Revachol feeling grown men's hands. If you want to find her husband, you'll need more *concrete* information.

links.title: Empathy: "It's always a challenge to describe..."
links.text: It's always a challenge to describe the person you know best in the world.

links.title: You: ""Let's try again. If I were trying..."
links.text: "Let's try again. If I were trying to meet him on the street, what would I look for?"

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Oh! Well, he's a bit shorter than..."
links.text: "Oh! Well, he's a bit shorter than you but with a larger frame. And he has longish white hair -- usually a bit uncombed, you might say *wild* even..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant pulls out his notebo..."
links.text: The lieutenant pulls out his notebook and begins jotting down the woman's description.

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""One other thing -- he'll likely ha..."
links.text: "One other thing -- he'll likely have all kinds of *field gear* on him, even if he's not out in the reeds. You know, just in case."

links.title: You: ""That's good enough. Let me ask you..."
links.text: "That's good enough. Let me ask you something else."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: "The woman's face flushes with embar..."
links.text: The woman's face flushes with embarrassment. "I'm sorry, sweetie. I'm afraid I'm not very good at this sort of thing."

links.title: You: ""How long have you been married?""
links.text: "How long have you been married?"

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""We'll be celebrating our *sixteent..."
links.text: "We'll be celebrating our *sixteenth anniversary* this autumn." Her smile is soft. "Not the most numerically satisfying anniversary, but I like the less obvious milestones even more, somehow..."

links.title: You: ""How did the two of you meet?""
links.text: "How did the two of you meet?"

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Via a dating agency, I'm ashamed t..."
links.text: "Via a dating agency, I'm ashamed to say. I was looking to get back into the scene after recovering from my accident, and he'd just divorced..."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""We hit it off and, well, here we a..."
links.text: "We hit it off and, well, here we are." She smiles wistfully.

links.title: Reaction Speed: "She's skipping over some important..."
links.text: She's skipping over some important parts... perhaps you'll find out more later.

links.title: You: ""I think I have all the information..."
links.text: "I think I have all the information I need. Let's move on." (Conclude.)

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""I hope I've been useful.""
links.text: "I hope I've been useful."

links.title: You: ""Tell me more about this *rare inse..."
links.text: "Tell me more about this *rare insect* your husband is looking for."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Oh, sweetie, it's *fascinating*......"
links.text: "Oh, sweetie, it's *fascinating*..." She catches herself. "But I shouldn't bore you with entomological minutiae."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant gives you a sideways..."
links.text: The lieutenant gives you a sideways glance.

links.title: You: ""No, I want to hear about the insec..."
links.text: "No, I want to hear about the insect."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Well," she hesitates. "It's a *pha..."
links.text: "Well," she hesitates. "It's a *phasmid* technically, but..."

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Ah, yes, *phasmatodea* -- a diverse..."
links.text: Ah, yes, *phasmatodea* -- a diverse group of insects whose bodies resemble twigs, leaves, that sort of thing. "Ghost insects," colloquially.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Oh yeah. Here comes the *interestin..."
links.text: Oh yeah. Here comes the *interesting*.

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""... where other phasmids imitate s..."
links.text: "... where other phasmids imitate sticks or leaves, this one's a living *reed*. It disguises itself among the reeds here on the Insulindian coast."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Hence its name: The *Insulindian p..."
links.text: "Hence its name: The *Insulindian phasmid* -- perhaps you'll end up co-discovering it with us, officer?" She looks you in the eye and nods thoughtfully.

links.title: Half Light: "There's a touch of *awe* in the way..."
links.text: There's a touch of *awe* in the way she enunciated the creature's name.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I knew it. "The lieutenant sighs...."
links.text: "I knew it. "The lieutenant sighs. "We're gonna be chasing made-up insects with *cryptozoologists*."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""It's not made-up, officer, I can *..."
links.text: "It's not made-up, officer, I can *assure* you."

links.title: Authority: "There's a hint of defensiveness to..."
links.text: There's a hint of defensiveness to her retort, but also confidence. She seems to sit up a little straighter in her chair.

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""It's simply *elusive*, so much so..."
links.text: "It's simply *elusive*, so much so that most *establishment* zoologists doubt it exists at all."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""To be honest, this animal sounds l..."
links.text: "To be honest, this animal sounds like a *cryptid* -- you wouldn't happen to be searching for some kind of... Gnome of Geroma would you?"

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "I smell pseudoscience, he's thinkin..."
links.text: I smell pseudoscience, he's thinking. Not a big fan of that.

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""It's simply *elusive*, so much so..."
links.text: "It's simply *elusive*, so much so that most *establishment* zoologists doubt it exists at all."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""*Establishment...*" His suspicion..."
links.text: "*Establishment...*" His suspicion is confirmed. "I thought so."

links.title: Rhetoric: "There's a touch of *awe* in the way..."
links.text: There's a touch of *awe* in the way she enunciates the creature's name.

links.title: You: ""What makes you think the phasmid i..."
links.text: "What makes you think the phasmid is around here?"

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Well, some teenagers making out in..."
links.text: "Well, some teenagers making out in the reeds saw one. They didn't know what it was, of course, but there was a brief article in a local newspaper. About their encounter with a *ghost insect* that looks like the reeds. Gary sent us the clipping."

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Interesting. Maybe the phasmid *mad..."
links.text: Interesting. Maybe the phasmid *made* the teenagers make out?

links.title: You: ""Maybe the phasmid *made* them make..."
links.text: "Maybe the phasmid *made* them make out?"

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: "She laughs. "I doubt it. It's not l..."
links.text: She laughs. "I doubt it. It's not like teenagers need much encouragement in *that* regard."

links.title: You: ""So a newspaper clipping is all the..."
links.text: "So a newspaper clipping is all the evidence you have?"

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Of course, most phasmid sightings..."
links.text: "Of course, most phasmid sightings turn out to be *false alarms*, but their description matched the Insulindian phasmid *perfectly*, and they didn't even know what they were looking at!"

links.title: Composure: "Enthusiasm has wiped the worry from..."
links.text: Enthusiasm has wiped the worry from her face. Her eyes sparkle behind her glasses.

links.title: You: ""You seem really excited about this..."
links.text: "You seem really excited about this cryptid."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""I suppose I have something of a *p..."
links.text: "I suppose I have something of a *personal* connection to the Insulindian phasmid... All scientists have their little hobby-horses."

links.title: You: ""So... is it dangerous?""
links.text: "So... is it dangerous?"

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: "She chuckles to herself. "Not at al..."
links.text: She chuckles to herself. "Not at all. Why else would it hide itself so carefully?"

links.title: You: ""Is it valuable?""
links.text: "Is it valuable?"

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Oh, I doubt it. No one gets into c..."
links.text: "Oh, I doubt it. No one gets into cryptozoology for the *money*, sweetie."

links.title: You: ""Does it have cool powers?""
links.text: "Does it have cool powers?"

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Yes! It can blend in almost *perfe..."
links.text: "Yes! It can blend in almost *perfectly* among the reeds." Her face lights up at the thought of it. "It's how it's stayed hidden all these years. Centuries even."

links.title: Savoir Faire: "That's not special at all. Of cours..."
links.text: That's not special at all. Of course it blends in, most insects do. You don't even have to be a stick insect for that...

links.title: You: ""Okay. What's so *special* about th..."
links.text: "Okay. What's so *special* about this stick-bug then?" (Move on.)

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Oh dear, I'm afraid I'm not explai..."
links.text: "Oh dear, I'm afraid I'm not explaining this very well. It *is* very special..." The woman's face flushes with embarrassment.

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Morell can explain it all much bet..."
links.text: "Morell can explain it all much better. I wish you could hear him describe it. Then you'd understand, I'm sure."

links.title: You: ""You're right. I don't have time fo..."
links.text: "You're right. I don't have time for insect facts right now. Let's talk about something else."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Of course, dear.""
links.text: "Of course, dear."

links.title: Reaction Speed: "She was about to launch into an imp..."
links.text: She was about to launch into an impassioned description, but stoppered herself. Why's that?

links.title: You: ""On second thought, things *are* ba..."
links.text: "On second thought, things *are* bad. I don't even know enough to know what I *don't* know about this world."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""You know where we *are*, right?""
links.text: "You know where we *are*, right?"

links.title: You: ""We're in the Whirling-in-Rags cafe..."
links.text: "We're in the Whirling-in-Rags cafeteria."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""That's right, and where is the Whi..."
links.text: "That's right, and where is the Whirling itself located?"

links.title: You: ""In... Revachol?""
links.text: "In... Revachol?"

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Yes, indeed. We are in the fine ci..."
links.text: "Yes, indeed. We are in the fine city of Revachol."

links.title: You: ""On something called *the urban coa..."
links.text: "On something called *the urban coast*."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Yes, we're in Martinaise, on the c..."
links.text: "Yes, we're in Martinaise, on the coast of Revachol."

links.title: You: ""The edge of civilization.""
links.text: "The edge of civilization."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""We're in the city of *Revachol*, d..."
links.text: "We're in the city of *Revachol*, dear." She flashes you a worried look.

links.title: You: ""In hell. We're all in hell.""
links.text: "In hell. We're all in hell."

links.title: You: ""See -- I have no idea.""
links.text: "See -- I have no idea."

links.title: You: ""We're in Martinaise.""
links.text: "We're in Martinaise."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""That's right! We're on the coast o..."
links.text: "That's right! We're on the coast of the city of Revachol, in the district of Martinaise."

links.title: You: ""Mhm, okay.""
links.text: "Mhm, okay."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Yes -- and Revachol...?" She exami..."
links.text: "Yes -- and Revachol...?" She examines you.

links.title: You: ""All I know is that Revachol used t..."
links.text: "All I know is that Revachol used to be really cool in the Thirties."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""The New! Disco dancing! It seems l..."
links.text: "The New! Disco dancing! It seems like a lifetime ago..." Her eyes are filled with light reflected off those gilded years, when the city seemed full of possibility.

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Much has changed, but it is still..."
links.text: "Much has changed, but it is still the most beautiful city in the world, a rare jewel set in the sand between the pines. Everyone says so, even foreigners." There's a pause as she studies your expression. You must look quite lost.

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Speaking of history -- you know wh..."
links.text: "Speaking of history -- you know what *year* it is, yes?"

links.title: You: ""It's the spring of '51.""
links.text: "It's the spring of '51."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""That's right, dear! How splendid!""
links.text: "That's right, dear! How splendid!"

links.title: Composure: "Her relief is palpable. She was get..."
links.text: Her relief is palpable. She was getting pretty worried about you there, but now she relaxes her shoulders...

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""That's right, dear! How splendid!..."
links.text: "That's right, dear! How splendid! Here, take this pen. Knowledge should always be rewarded."

links.title: You: ""I know it's the '50s, but I'm not..."
links.text: "I know it's the '50s, but I'm not sure about the year."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Good, dear, you got the decade rig..."
links.text: "Good, dear, you got the decade right! It's the spring of '51."

links.title: Drama: "Though she praises you, it is clear..."
links.text: Though she praises you, it is clear that she was taken aback by your response.

links.title: Shivers: "Outside, spring rain seeps into the..."
links.text: Outside, spring rain seeps into the cracks in the walls and the cobblestone streets, and into grated storm drains. All the way down into the sewers... Above ground, the first May bells blossom.

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""I can tell that this is taxing for..."
links.text: "I can tell that this is taxing for you, so I'll just ask *one* more question. What regime are we living under? What mode of government?"

links.title: You: ""I believe Revachol is being manage..."
links.text: "I believe Revachol is being managed by something called... the Coalition?"

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Precisely, sweetie! Revachol is wh..."
links.text: "Precisely, sweetie! Revachol is what's called a Zone of Control, led by an alliance of foreign powers. We have almost no government of our own, sadly..."

links.title: You: ""If there's no government, how come..."
links.text: "If there's no government, how come there are cops?"

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Oh dear..." She shakes her head, s..."
links.text: "Oh dear..." She shakes her head, suddenly very worried. "And you were doing so well. There aren't *really* any cops in Revachol, not in the traditional sense. The status of law enforcement has been a complicated matter since the Revolution..."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""But we should stop for today, swee..."
links.text: "But we should stop for today, sweetie. You look like you need a break. Besides, I'm not the best person to explain the *big* things to anyone..."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Oh dear, this *is* troubling. You..."
links.text: "Oh dear, this *is* troubling. You really ought to know that -- being one yourself. There aren't *really* any cops in Revachol, not in the traditional sense. The status of law enforcement has been a complicated matter since the Revolution..."

links.title: You: ""I don't even know what to say. I'm..."
links.text: "I don't even know what to say. I'm so disappointed."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""It is quite disappointing, yes. A..."
links.text: "It is quite disappointing, yes. A lot of people would like some form of representation. There's *talk*, but... for now, the RCM is all we've got."

links.title: You: ""Some kind of democracy maybe?""
links.text: "Some kind of democracy maybe?"

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Nope. Sadly not. Revachol is what'..."
links.text: "Nope. Sadly not. Revachol is what's called a Zone of Control. Under an alliance of foreign powers called the Coalition. We have no government of our own and what democracy we have is..." She thinks. "Market driven."

links.title: Rhetoric: "Meaning: buying is voting."
links.text: Meaning: buying is voting.

links.title: You: ""I'd *like* to think it's the dicta..."
links.text: "I'd *like* to think it's the dictatorship of the proletariat, but something tells me it's not."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Oh sweetie..." she smiles a sad sm..."
links.text: "Oh sweetie..." she smiles a sad smile. "It's really not. There used to be people who thought that way -- other people, who wanted those things -- but... they all went extinct."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Revachol is a Zone of Control, led..."
links.text: "Revachol is a Zone of Control, led by an alliance of foreign powers called the Coalition. We have almost no government of our own. And *certainly* no dictatorship of the proletariat."

links.title: Rhetoric: "But they still have cops..."
links.text: But they still have cops...

links.title: You: ""Our leaders are fierce warriors wh..."
links.text: "Our leaders are fierce warriors who traverse the plains on steeds."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Oh... no, nothing like that, dear...."
links.text: "Oh... no, nothing like that, dear. Revachol is a Zone of Control, led by an alliance of foreign powers called the Coalition. We have almost no government of our own. And certainly not one who's horseback."

links.title: Physical Instrument: "Oh no. We've arrived at some sort o..."
links.text: Oh no. We've arrived at some sort of *weak* world, where everyone's a nansy pansy...

links.title: You: ""We are governed by intelligent mac..."
links.text: "We are governed by intelligent machines that perform calculations to determine the *freest* market. Everyone hustles and grinds like a bad ass visionary."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Oh... no, nothing like that, dear...."
links.text: "Oh... no, nothing like that, dear. Revachol is a Zone of Control, led by an alliance of foreign powers called the Coalition. We have almost no government of our own -- certainly no machines."

links.title: Rhetoric: "I don't know... still looks like th..."
links.text: I don't know... still looks like there's a lot of hustling going on. Maybe she's wrong. Also...

links.title: You: ""Radios are being used to control p..."
links.text: "Radios are being used to control people's minds and distort our perception of reality, concealing our true masters: foreigners and *women*."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Oh... no, nothing like that, dear...."
links.text: "Oh... no, nothing like that, dear. Revachol is a Zone of Control, led by an alliance of foreign powers called the Coalition. We have almost no government of our own. And certainly no matriarchy..."

links.title: Rhetoric: "She's trying to avoid the foreigner..."
links.text: She's trying to avoid the foreigners part. This is because she's a woman. She may be *lying* to you...

links.title: You: ""Cop. We are living under the cop-r..."
links.text: "Cop. We are living under the cop-regime."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Actually..." She raises her finger..."
links.text: "Actually..." She raises her finger. "We are *not*. You could say that about almost any other nation, but not Revachol. Try *one* more time, officer -- what mode of government?"

links.title: Authority: "Damn it, I was really hoping it wou..."
links.text: Damn it, I was really hoping it would be a Cop World. Okay, well, let's see...

links.title: You: ""It's totally '43.""
links.text: "It's totally '43."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Oh no, dear! It's the early spring..."
links.text: "Oh no, dear! It's the early spring of '51."

links.title: Composure: "She leans back in her chair, alarme..."
links.text: She leans back in her chair, alarmed by your answer.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant tries to pretend he'..."
links.text: The lieutenant tries to pretend he's not hearing it and is out of the conversation.

links.title: You: ""Sure. It's the year 973.""
links.text: "Sure. It's the year 973."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""You're joking. Try again, one more..."
links.text: "You're joking. Try again, one more time. What year is it?"

links.title: You: ""All I know is: we are approaching..."
links.text: "All I know is: we are approaching the *end times*."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Perhaps, dear, perhaps. But for no..."
links.text: "Perhaps, dear, perhaps. But for now it's just the spring of '51."

links.title: Inland Empire: "She is perturbed by your not knowin..."
links.text: She is perturbed by your not knowing what year it is -- but not by your mention of the apocalypse. It *must* be the end times.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant studies you, rubbing..."
links.text: The lieutenant studies you, rubbing his chin.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "I'm beginning to suspect that you m..."
links.text: I'm beginning to suspect that you might indeed be completely adrift in this reality, thinks the lieutenant. How can it be *that* bad? Never mind -- we're in this now.

links.title: You: ""It's a bad year in my late forties..."
links.text: "It's a bad year in my late forties, or fifties? I don't even know how *old* I am."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""There, there. The year is '51, and..."
links.text: "There, there. The year is '51, and spring has only just started. I'm sure there are better days ahead."

links.title: Composure: "She looks flustered, her hands smoo..."
links.text: She looks flustered, her hands smoothing out the creases in her blanket even as she attempts to reassure you.

links.title: Logic: "The New was in the Thirties, and tw..."
links.text: The New was in the Thirties, and two decades have elapsed since The New, so it must be the Fifties now.

links.title: Conceptualization: "That tape you picked up said '43. Y..."
links.text: That tape you picked up said '43. You seem to be a hip modern man who listens to hip modern records, so it must be '43.

links.title: You: ""Revachol is the disgraced capital..."
links.text: "Revachol is the disgraced capital of the world. Something like that?"

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Yes, great, see -- we're getting s..."
links.text: "Yes, great, see -- we're getting somewhere. What else do you know about our city of splendour? Tattered as she may be..."

links.title: You: ""Honestly, I don't really know anyt..."
links.text: "Honestly, I don't really know anything about Revachol."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: "Her grey eyes widen. "Oh my. How wo..."
links.text: Her grey eyes widen. "Oh my. How would I even begin to tell you? Revachol is the most beautiful city in the world. We're fortunate to be here, you and I."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""I haven't seen very many other cit..."
links.text: "I haven't seen very many other cities personally, but everyone says so. Revachol is a rare jewel. This city used to rule the world... Though it has seen better days." There's a pause as she studies your expression. You must look quite lost.

links.title: You: ""We're in Revachol.""
links.text: "We're in Revachol."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""That's right! In a hostel called t..."
links.text: "That's right! In a hostel called the Whirling-in-Rags, to be precise."

links.title: You: ""On Insulinde?""
links.text: "On Insulinde?"

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Yes, but, more specifically -- on..."
links.text: "Yes, but, more specifically -- on the coast of the city of Revachol, in the district of Martinaise."

links.title: You: ""I don't really know... some seedy..."
links.text: "I don't really know... some seedy hotel?"

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""A seaside hostel called the Whirli..."
links.text: "A seaside hostel called the Whirling-in-Rags, to be precise. And the Whirling itself is in Revachol."

links.title: You: ""A war zone. At the edge of the wor..."
links.text: "A war zone. At the edge of the world."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""It does still look like that in so..."
links.text: "It does still look like that in some parts of the city, doesn't it..."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""We are in a hostel called the Whir..."
links.text: "We are in a hostel called the Whirling-in-Rags, dear. And the Whirling itself is in the city of Revachol."

links.title: You: ""We're dead. Haunting each other. W..."
links.text: "We're dead. Haunting each other. We're ghosts."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Now, now." She tilts her head as s..."
links.text: "Now, now." She tilts her head as she looks up at you with maternal solicitude.

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""We are alive -- in a hostel called..."
links.text: "We are alive -- in a hostel called the Whirling-in-Rags. And the Whirling itself is in the city of Revachol."

links.title: You: ""You don't notice this about me, bu..."
links.text: "You don't notice this about me, but actually -- I have lost all memory of the world and myself and I have no idea what I'm doing."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: "She frowns, looking you over. "Sure..."
links.text: She frowns, looking you over. "Surely things can't be *that* bad?"

links.title: Inland Empire: "You sense that she won't judge you,..."
links.text: You sense that she won't judge you, no matter what you say.

links.title: You: ""Things aren't *bad*. They're catas..."
links.text: "Things aren't *bad*. They're catastrophic."

links.title: You: ""I hope you're right. I hope it's n..."
links.text: "I hope you're right. I hope it's not too bad..."

links.title: You: ""Yeah, I'm blowing this whole thing..."
links.text: "Yeah, I'm blowing this whole thing out of proportion. Forget I said anything."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: "She nods, but still looks worried."
links.text: She nods, but still looks worried.

links.title: Interfacing: "Why would he be *vague* about phone..."
links.text: Why would he be *vague* about phone problems? This is something to look into later -- ask Garte maybe.

links.title: You: ""Why did you need to use the phone,..."
links.text: "Why did you need to use the phone, anyway?"

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""To let the young woman who's house..."
links.text: "To let the young woman who's house-sitting for us know that we may be delayed. Morell, my husband, and Gary were supposed to get back by Monday night, but they're still missing and I haven't heard from them..."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""I was also hoping she'd heard from..."
links.text: "I was also hoping she'd heard from Morell..." She looks down.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We ran into your husband on the co..."
links.text: "We ran into your husband on the coast, madam. He was just going to finish up some work and then come back."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Are you sure it was him? Oh, thank..."
links.text: "Are you sure it was him? Oh, thank heavens! Silly me." She smiles, though there's still concern in her features.

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""I knew what I was getting into whe..."
links.text: "I knew what I was getting into when I married a *cryptozoologist*, of course. It's just... Waiting for him to come back from field work is always nerve-racking..."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Still, I should have *known* he'd..."
links.text: "Still, I should have *known* he'd be returning late this time around. Finding the Insulindian phasmid -- it's *very* important to him." She glances out the window toward the bay.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I believe we ran into your husband..."
links.text: "I believe we ran into your husband on the coast, madam. He seemed to be busy setting up some trap, so we didn't talk to him much."

links.title: You: ""I think I ran into your husband on..."
links.text: "I think I ran into your husband on the coast. He seemed to be busy, so I didn't talk to him much."

links.title: Logic: "A little missing person's puzzle mi..."
links.text: A little missing person's puzzle might be just the thing to take your mind off the hangover.

links.title: Authority: "You hear that? Someone's *missing*...."
links.text: You hear that? Someone's *missing*. There could be *foul play* afoot!

links.title: You: "I love missing persons cases."
