links.text: I love missing persons cases.

links.title: Authority: "That's right. Now skip the foreplay..."
links.text: That's right. Now skip the foreplay. Time to dive into the dark alleys, start shaking down the usual suspects -- you know, *legwork*.

links.title: Volition: "Doing some *good* will alleviate th..."
links.text: Doing some *good* will alleviate the hangover. At least you're of use to *someone*.

links.title: You: "Missing persons aren't really my st..."
links.text: Missing persons aren't really my style.

links.title: Authority: "You don't have a *style*, you have..."
links.text: You don't have a *style*, you have a *duty*. Now start asking questions, like a real law enforcement official.

links.title: You: "Why do *I* have to play Rescueman?"
links.text: Why do *I* have to play Rescueman?

links.title: Authority: "To redeem yourself before the hoods..."
links.text: To redeem yourself before the hoods of Law. Now start asking questions, like a real law enforcement official.

links.title: You: ""Okay, I'll bite. Has your husband..."
links.text: "Okay, I'll bite. Has your husband gone missing before?"

links.title: You: ""This sounds more like a side thing..."
links.text: "This sounds more like a side thing. I need to take care of my *main thing* -- then I'll get back to this." [Leave.]

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Of course, sweetie. I'm probably w..."
links.text: "Of course, sweetie. I'm probably working myself up over nothing anyway. I'll be right here." She glances out the window toward the bay.

links.title: You: ""About your pin...""
links.text: "About your pin..."

links.title: You: "Maybe you could convince her to tel..."
links.text: Maybe you could convince her to tell you about some *cool* cryptids?

links.title: Half Light: "She's scared now. She's realized yo..."
links.text: She's scared now. She's realized you really are brain damaged.

links.title: You: ""So -- how did I do?""
links.text: "So -- how did I do?"

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""You were doing quite well up until..."
links.text: "You were doing quite well up until the end there. It *does* look like you're having trouble remembering things. History and places. Remembering *Reality*, in a word. It's very odd..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "A sigh. The lieutenant buries his n..."
links.text: A sigh. The lieutenant buries his nose in his notebook.

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""But -- maybe a *fresh set of eyes*..."
links.text: "But -- maybe a *fresh set of eyes* is what the world needs? And -- while I'm no doctor -- such bouts of amnesia are often temporary. So I wouldn't worry *too* much."

links.title: Volition: "She means this sincerely. Worrying..."
links.text: She means this sincerely. Worrying won't do you any good.

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""You didn't do very well, dear. It..."
links.text: "You didn't do very well, dear. It does look like you're having trouble remembering things. History and places. Remembering *Reality*, in a word. It's very odd..."

links.title: You: ""What is the *Revolution* you menti..."
links.text: "What is the *Revolution* you mentioned?"

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""A defeat, I'm afraid. The people o..."
links.text: "A defeat, I'm afraid. The people of this archipelago tried to build something new, something *different*. The rest of the world didn't like it, so they came and ended it. This was forty two years ago."

links.title: You: ""What does that have to do with the..."
links.text: "What does that have to do with there not being any cops?"

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""It has something to do with everyt..."
links.text: "It has something to do with everything. I really don't know how to explain it better..."

links.title: Empathy: "I'm just a poor woman, she thinks...."
links.text: I'm just a poor woman, she thinks. What do I know of these things. And how can I help you?

links.title: You: ""Who could tell me more?" (Conclude..."
links.text: "Who could tell me more?" (Conclude.)

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Someone more educated in *sweeping..."
links.text: "Someone more educated in *sweeping* matters? Maybe you should ask..." She turns to the lieutenant.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No." He looks away. "I'm not an en..."
links.text: "No." He looks away. "I'm not an encyclopedia. I won't be a guide either. I'm a police officer."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Of course." She turns to you. "The..."
links.text: "Of course." She turns to you. "Then I don't know. Someone rich maybe? Wealthy people are educated. Though I don't know where you would find a wealthy person in Martinaise..."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Someone more educated in these thi..."
links.text: "Someone more educated in these things than me? Someone rich, maybe? Wealthy people are educated. Though I don't know where you would find a wealthy person in Martinaise..."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Well... I'm not sure, detective. I..."
links.text: "Well... I'm not sure, detective. I'm sorry. Wealthy people tend to be educated, but you're not likely to find one of those in Martinaise..."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""But thank you, sweetie. You did ma..."
links.text: "But thank you, sweetie. You did make me forget about my worries for a while." She smiles up at you, but concern is creeping back into her expression.

links.title: You: ""I'd really like to hear about more..."
links.text: "I'd really like to hear about more cryptids."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You know... to hell with it, let's..."
links.text: "You know... to hell with it, let's have more cryptids."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Of course, officers." She smiles p..."
links.text: "Of course, officers." She smiles politely. "Is there a particular cryptid you two are interested in learning about?"

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Of course, dear. Is there a partic..."
links.text: "Of course, dear. Is there a particular cryptid that you're interested in learning about?"

links.title: Logic: "It must have been the Whirling land..."
links.text: It must have been the Whirling landline that Klaasje "nicked."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Lieutenant Kitsuragi." He shakes h..."
links.text: "Lieutenant Kitsuragi." He shakes her hand brusquely. "May I ask what you needed to use the phone for, ma'am?"

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""To let the young woman who's house..."
links.text: "To let the young woman who's house-sitting for us know that we may be delayed. Morell -- my husband -- and our friend Gary were supposed to get back by Monday night, but they're still missing and I haven't heard from them..."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""I was also hoping she'd heard from..."
links.text: "I was also hoping she'd heard from Morell..." She looks down.

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Oh, forgive me for not introducing..."
links.text: "Oh, forgive me for not introducing myself. My name is Lena. My husband and I are staying with our friend Gary just down the street, but I come here for tea when they're away."

links.title: You: ""What did you need the phone for an..."
links.text: "What did you need the phone for anyway?"

links.title: You: ""That's all for now, ma'am." [Leave..."
links.text: "That's all for now, ma'am." [Leave.]

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Officer... I hate to ask, but perh..."
links.text: "Officer... I hate to ask, but perhaps you could check those traps one more time? Only if you're in the area... In truth, I know Gary won't be up to it, and I'm concerned about my husband's health..."

links.title: You: ""Alright, when you put it that way..."
links.text: "Alright, when you put it that way -- I'll help." (Accept task.)

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Oh, thank you so much. And don't c..."
links.text: "Oh, thank you so much. And don't catch a cold out there!" She smiles up at you brightly.

links.title: You: ""Sorry, I have too many other thing..."
links.text: "Sorry, I have too many other things on my plate. Wish you the best of luck." (Reject task.)

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""I understand. Best of luck with yo..."
links.text: "I understand. Best of luck with your work as well." She smiles up at you, doing her best not to look disappointed.

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Just a moment, officer..." She smi..."
links.text: "Just a moment, officer..." She smiles up at you nervously. "If you run into my husband again... do tell him I'm worried, and to hurry back."

links.title: Inland Empire: "Do it. Who knows what cryptozoologi..."
links.text: Do it. Who knows what cryptozoological mysteries will be uncovered?

links.title: You: ""Sure thing, ma'am." (Accept the ta..."
links.text: "Sure thing, ma'am." (Accept the task)

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Oh, thank you so much sweetie. Goo..."
links.text: "Oh, thank you so much sweetie. Good luck with your investigation now."

links.title: You: ""I'm sorry, I don't want to get inv..."
links.text: "I'm sorry, I don't want to get involved in your affairs." (Refuse the task)

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Of course, sweetie. Good luck with..."
links.text: "Of course, sweetie. Good luck with your investigation."

dialogueTree.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Hello, dear. It's good to see a fa..."
dialogueTree.text: "Hello, dear. It's good to see a familiar face." The elderly woman smiles up at you hopefully.

dialogueTree.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Oh, hello, sweetie. So nice to see..."
dialogueTree.text: "Oh, hello, sweetie. So nice to see you again."

dialogueTree.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Oh sweetie," she says, beaming. "I..."
dialogueTree.text: "Oh sweetie," she says, beaming. "I don't even know how to thank you for finding my husband and helping him out. I hope we haven't been too much trouble for you..."

links.title: You: ""Just doing my job, ma'am.""
links.text: "Just doing my job, ma'am."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Here, I want to give you a small t..."
links.text: "Here, I want to give you a small token of my gratitude." She hands you a thin ribbon held together by a silver bird skull. "It's a tie, Mesque in origin. The pin is an antique... quite special."

links.title: Interfacing: "The little silvery knob holding the..."
links.text: The little silvery knob holding the tie together feels warm in your hand. It's in the shape of an avian skull. With *eight* eyes.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "You could ask her about this, when..."
links.text: You could ask her about this, when you get the time -- it's probably a cryptid. But the phasmid, of course, is more important...

links.title: You: ""It was a truly epic long distance..."
links.text: "It was a truly epic long distance trek."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Truly -- a lot of legwork. My part..."
links.text: "Truly -- a lot of legwork. My partner *adores* these kinds of things..." The lieutenant is still catching his breath.

links.title: You: ""It was just on my way while I was..."
links.text: "It was just on my way while I was working the case."

links.title: You: ""I'm basically also a cryptozoologi..."
links.text: "I'm basically also a cryptozoologist now."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I knew it..." you hear Kim say qui..."
links.text: "I knew it..." you hear Kim say quietly to himself.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "I'm not surprised it's already gett..."
links.text: I'm not surprised it's already getting out of hand.

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Well, in that case sweetie, let me..."
links.text: "Well, in that case sweetie, let me give you a small token of my gratitude." She hands you a ribbon-tie held together by a silver bird skull. "It's a tie, Mesque in origin. The pin is an antique... quite special to the cryptozoological community."

dialogueTree.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Thank you so much for helping us o..."
dialogueTree.text: "Thank you so much for helping us out with our research, sweetie," she says, beaming. "I hope all of this hasn't been too much of a distraction for you..."

dialogueTree.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Oh, hello, dear. There you are aga..."
dialogueTree.text: "Oh, hello, dear. There you are again." She sounds glad to see you.

dialogueTree.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Oh, hello, dear. I didn't notice y..."
dialogueTree.text: "Oh, hello, dear. I didn't notice you at first." She smiles up at you distractedly.

dialogueTree.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Oh, hello, dear. I didn't notice y..."
dialogueTree.text: "Oh, hello, dear. I didn't notice you at first." She smiles up at you distractedly.

links.title: You: ""So why did you need to make that c..."
links.text: "So why did you need to make that call?"

links.title: You: ""Is everything alright?""
links.text: "Is everything alright?"

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""You see, Morell, my husband, and G..."
links.text: "You see, Morell, my husband, and Gary were supposed to get back Monday night, but they're still missing and I haven't heard from them..."

links.title: You: ""So, about your husband... Does he..."
links.text: "So, about your husband... Does he often go missing?"

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""That's just it! This isn't like hi..."
links.text: "That's just it! This isn't like him at all. He always plans his expeditions so carefully..."

links.title: Shivers: "A cold breeze hisses through dense..."
links.text: A cold breeze hisses through dense thickets of reeds.... Something sweet in it, somnolent. A damp chill goes down your spine. When you look around, you're still in the Whirling-in-Rags.

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: "But you have more important things..."
links.text: But you have more important things to worry about. She glances out the window toward the bay.

links.title: Conceptualization: "More important than a missing *expe..."
links.text: More important than a missing *expedition?* I don't know... expeditions often lead to something interesting.

links.title: You: ""Hello again, ma'am. So why did you..."
links.text: "Hello again, ma'am. So why did you need to make that call?"

links.title: You: ""Is everything alright, ma'am?""
links.text: "Is everything alright, ma'am?"

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""You see, Morell, my husband, and G..."
links.text: "You see, Morell, my husband, and Gary were supposed to get back Monday night, but they're still missing and I haven't heard from them..."

links.title: You: ""So, about your husband... Does he..."
links.text: "So, about your husband... Does he often go missing?"

dialogueTree.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Just a moment." The old woman turn..."
dialogueTree.text: "Just a moment." The old woman turns back to the cafeteria manager.

links.title: Composure: "She's agitated, judging from the wa..."
links.text: She's agitated, judging from the way she keeps pulling at the frayed edge of her blanket.

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""And there's no public phones nearb..."
links.text: "And there's no public phones nearby?"

links.title: Garte, the Cafeteria Manager: ""The closest phone booth is down th..."
links.text: "The closest phone booth is down the coast. Sorry for the inconvenience, ma'am." The cafeteria manager appears genuinely apologetic.

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""It's fine, I understand. Thank you..."
links.text: "It's fine, I understand. Thank you anyway." She turns back to you with a weary smile. "I'm glad to see you again, dear."

links.title: Suggestion: "The lady is distressed. Perhaps som..."
links.text: The lady is distressed. Perhaps something more up-beat might cheer her up?

links.title: You: ""Howdy, Lena! What's kicking?""
links.text: "Howdy, Lena! What's kicking?"

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Please don't trouble yourself abou..."
links.text: "Please don't trouble yourself about me, sweetie. I was just hoping to make a call, but the Whirling's phone line isn't working."

links.title: Empathy: "A faint smile tells you she appreci..."
links.text: A faint smile tells you she appreciates the effort, but at the moment her mind is on more serious matters...

links.title: You: ""Good day, ma'am. Everything alrigh..."
links.text: "Good day, ma'am. Everything alright?"

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Please don't trouble yourself abou..."
links.text: "Please don't trouble yourself about me, sweetie. I was just hoping to make a call, but the Whirling's phone line isn't working."

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""The Union office probably has a ph..."
links.text: "The Union office probably has a phone, but I can't really get there, or to the phone booth down the coast... And Gary's phone is dead, too..." She sighs.

links.title: Logic: "No mystery here -- this is Klaasje'..."
links.text: No mystery here -- this is Klaasje's handiwork. She cut the line.

links.title: You: ""Wait, what's wrong with the phone..."
links.text: "Wait, what's wrong with the phone line?"

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""The manager was vague about it." S..."
links.text: "The manager was vague about it." She frowns.

links.title: Logic: "It must have been the Whirling land..."
links.text: It must have been the Whirling landline that Klaasje "nicked."

links.title: You: ""Sorry, ma'am, I didn't mean to eav..."
links.text: "Sorry, ma'am, I didn't mean to eavesdrop on your conversation. Tell me how I might make it up to you?"

links.title: You: ""You seem busy. I'll come back late..."
links.text: "You seem busy. I'll come back later." [Leave.]

dialogueTree.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""Just a moment, officer.""

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: "She turns back to the cafeteria man..."
links.text: She turns back to the cafeteria manager. "And there's no public phones nearby?"

links.title: Composure: "She's agitated and keeps pulling at..."
links.text: She's agitated and keeps pulling at the frayed edge of her blanket.

links.text: "The closest phone booth is down the coast. Sorry for the inconvenience, ma'am." He appears to be genuinely apologetic.

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""It's fine, I understand. Thank you..."
links.text: "It's fine, I understand. Thank you anyway." She turns back to you with a weary smile. "Now, then."

links.title: You: ""Good day, ma'am. Everything alrigh..."
links.text: "Good day, ma'am. Everything alright?"

links.title: Logic: "No mystery here -- this is Klaasje'..."
links.text: No mystery here -- this is Klaasje's handiwork.

links.title: You: ""Wait, what's wrong with the phone..."
links.text: "Wait, what's wrong with the phone line?"

links.title: Lena, the Cryptozoologist's wife: ""The manager was vague about it." S..."
links.text: "The manager was vague about it." She frowns.

links.title: Interfacing: "Why would he be vague? This is some..."
links.text: Why would he be vague? This is something to look into later. Ask Garte maybe.

links.title: You: ""What did you need the phone for an..."
links.text: "What did you need the phone for anyway?"

links.title: You: ""Sorry, ma'am, I didn't mean to eav..."
links.text: "Sorry, ma'am, I didn't mean to eavesdrop on your conversation. Tell me how I might make it up to you?"

links.title: You: ""You seem busy. I'll come back late..."
links.text: "You seem busy. I'll come back later." [Leave.]
